caption:
The photograph showcases a city welcome sign (labeled "Makakilo City") mounted on a stone wall that outlines the bold, green letters of the city's name. The sign appears weathered, indicating it has been there for a while. Adjacent to the sign, there are two other signs on a post: one is a Lions Club International emblem featuring a logo and the caption "We Serve," indicating active local civic engagement, and another is a "Welcome To Makakilo" sign that looks quite faded and worn. On the left side of the frame, there is a sliver of the road with a vintage white car passing by, suggesting the photo might be from the mid-20th century. This car is in motion, adding a dynamic element to the otherwise static scene.

The surroundings include lush green plants and grasses at the base of the stone wall, injecting a vibrant natural element into the urban setting. The background shows a clear sky and a few wispy clouds, with hints of more tropical vegetation and utility poles stretching into the distance. This typical suburban scenery with well-maintained streets likely indicates a calm, residential neighborhood. Additionally, the presence of electrical lines and well-paved roads suggest infrastructure and development in the city.
title: Makakilo is built on a dry, rock slope. Environmentalists hailed its designation for urban development, made ten years ago because it was clearly not suitable to agriculture.
